title: Dragonheart Screening + Q&A with Charles Pogue
brief_description: Please join us for the screening of DRAGONHEART, written by Kentucky's own Charles Edward Pogue (THE FLY, PSYCHO III)
description:
In honor of his appearance at this year's Harry Dean Stanton Fest, we are hosting two Dennis Quaid screenings during the month of June!


Please join us on Tuesday, June 19 for the 1996 film DRAGONHEART, written by Kentucky's own Charles Edward Pogue (THE FLY, PSYCHO III). Mr. Pogue will join us to discuss the film and share some behind-the-scenes stories from his time on set.


This is a free event.

All ages. Free event.

title: Mind Over Madness
brief_description: Join creatives from around the Mid East, including Louisville, Lexington, Indianapolis, Cincinnati, and Nashville. Be with us, as we try and find, our Mind Over Madness.
description:
*This Event is Completely Free, and Available to All Ages // 21+ to drink. (Drinks will NOT be sold on premise). See below for a list of all the creatives.*



In a world ran by technology, social media, government propaganda, and the ever looming threats of war, it's difficult to find peace in the chaos. The fear of isolation, desolation, and degradation created what many are led to believe as a modern dystopia. Surprisingly enough, many believed much of these modern travesty wouldn't even exist, let alone set us in turmoil, merely 18 years ago.


On the brink of the millennia, Y2K, the decadence of the growing society either celebrated its sudden collapse, or reveled at its apocalyptic forthcoming. A dire time it was, to find any salvation we could.


Through the reality of fear, pain instilled within the culture. People rioted, fought in outrage, and expedited their own predicted end. And yet. Through all of the pain, many found salvation through the pursuit of pleasure. Side tracking their angst and fear, with embracing the luxuries and celebrations of the times.


Mind Over Madness is the bridge that connects these two seemingly distinct worlds. Content raging from Visual Art, Fashion, Dance, and Live Music, all encompassing the ideals of pain v. pleasure and how we as people either succumb or rebel to the inner makings of our very existence.


Join creatives from around the Mid East, including Louisville, Lexington, Indianapolis, Cincinnati, and Nashville. All coming together to deliver an experience only rivaled by the human phenomenon. Be with us, as we try and find, our Mind Over Madness.


Brought to you by:

-The Parachute Factory

-The Liberty House Series


Sounds Enhanced by:

-$weetboy (Jon$ey)


Lights and Audio by:

-Chris Wheeler


Creative Director:

-Jake Mannino


Program Director:

-Brandon Wiitala


Visual art:

-DeeDot King

-Preston Harris

-Homegrown Collectives

-Happiest Sad

-Never Have a Bad Day

-PJ

-John Faughender

-Elmer Lopez

-Evan Mattingly


Fashion Lines:

-Obseen

-DopeSellsItself

-Bvmmy


Models:

-Miss Markie

-Tess

-Kellen Crosby

-Zay

-Abby Coyle

-Catnip

-Forrest Schmitt

-Jordan Lanham

-Cali


Dance:

-Javier Perez


Music:

-Nostalgic 1996 Collective

-Mike Bandanna

-Suicide Rascal


Charitable Cause:


To help combat the impending future we all face, we will be collecting donations to give some of the proceeds to the local Cincinnati charity, Mill Creek Alliance. They are working to restore Mill Creek (which is actually a river), which over 20 years ago was listed as one of the top five most polluted rivers in the country, after years and years of companies in Cincinnati dumping waste straight into it. Now, through the Mill Creek Alliance, Mill Creek is no longer on that list, as almost every single major polluting site has been shut down, and now native species of animals are starting to return to the creek. Mill Creek became a physical representation of the dystopian world we have created, but still symbolizes a hope for change. Help us support our model of peace in this decaying world.


You can find more about the organization through the groundwork’s website: http://groundworkcincinnati.org


Also follow them at: 

Facebook- https://m.facebook.com/Groundwork-Cincinnati-Mill-Creek-357896417888/


Twitter- https://twitter.com/GroundworkCincy


Instagram- https://instagram.com/groundworkcincy/

title: Excessive Realness
brief_description: A dance intensive geared toward LGTBQIA+ dancers and performing artists, has opened registration and is welcoming participants
description:
Excessive Realness, a dance intensive geared toward LGTBQIA+ dancers and performing artists, has opened registration and is welcoming participants!


The intensive takes place at the Pam Miller Downtown Arts Complex in Lexington, KY, Tuesday June 26th to Friday June 29th, 2018. Classes begin at 10am on Tuesday and the intensive ends with a performance, called The SPILL, on Friday evening. The performance is free and open to the public. 


Register NOW!


The intensive costs $150 total, plus a registration fee. This includes 12 classes, 3 roundtable discussions with artists, and priority seating for the performance. We have financial scholarships available. If you are in need of a financial scholarship, please contact us.


The Guest Artists, who will both teach and perform at the intensive, are:


Ya-Ya Fairley, 

teaching 'Disruptive Bodies: Performance Lab in Bodily Release and Resistance'


Kristi Faulkner (Kristi Faulkner Dance), 

teaching 'Falling & Rolling'


Ally Garcia, 

teaching 'Hip Hop' 


Anna Maynard, 

teaching 'Improvisation: An act of 'homing'


Donald C. Shorter Jr.,

teaching 'Bill T. Jones/Arnie Zane Masterclass'


We are very excited for all of the Guest Artists! 


This intensive is the first of its kind in the US and we hope that you will consider being apart of this amazing opportunity.


Saturday

June 30th is Lexington's Pride Festival, we hope that you can also stay for those festivities. Any questions or concerns can be answered by the Co-Directors Allison Blakeney (Allison.Blakeney@gmail.com) and Anthony Alterio (Anthony.m.alterio@gmail.com), or send them a message on the Excessive Realness Facebook Page.

title: Director Tour
brief_description: Director Stuart Horodner leads a tour of the Reuben Kadish: Witness and Frankensteinian exhibitions.
description: Director Stuart Horodner leads a tour of the Reuben Kadish: Witness and Frankensteinian exhibitions. Free and open to the public.

title: HDS Fest Pre-Party with Mandeville
brief_description: Mandeville, featuring Peach Reasoner and Gina Segall, will share some of Harry's favorite songs in the way that he most loved to perform them: in three part harmony
description:
We are thrilled to partner with our friends at the Green Lantern for a tribute to Harry Dean Stanton's love of music!


Jamie James (The Harry Dean Stanton Band, The Kingbees, Steppenwolf, Dennis Quaid and the Sharks) has assembled a new band, Mandeville, and is putting together a set inspired by decades of making music with Harry to kick-start this year's festival. Mandeville, featuring Peach Reasoner and Gina Segall, will share some of Harry's favorite songs in the way that he most loved to perform them: in three part harmony. This will be a VERY special night dedicated to Harry and his love of music by one of the people who knew him best.


Doors at 8, Music at 9

title: Dennis Quaid & The Sharks at The Burl
brief_description: Harry Dean Stanton Fest is thrilled to welcome Dennis Quaid and the Sharks to The Burl
description:
Harry Dean Stanton Fest is thrilled to welcome Dennis Quaid and the Sharks to The Burl!


A decades-long friend of Harry Dean, Dennis Quaid formed the Sharks in the year 2000 after an impromptu decision to join Harry Dean on stage introduced him to his future band. That fortuitous moment began a musical partnership with Harry Dean's bassist/friend, Jamie James (Steppenwolf), which has lasted to this day. Dennis and Jamie are excited to perform at this year's festival in honor of their much loved and much missed friend, Harry Dean.


Doors at 9 pm

Show at 10 pm

title: Crossing Mulholland + Q&A with Tom Thurman and Guests
brief_description: Harry Dean Stanton Fest began in February of 2011 with the premiere of Tom Thurman's incredible Kentucky Muse documentary HARRY DEAN STANTON: CROSSING MULHOLLAND
description:
Opening Night of Harry Dean Stanton Fest!


Harry Dean Stanton Fest began in February of 2011 with the premiere of Tom Thurman's incredible Kentucky Muse documentary HARRY DEAN STANTON: CROSSING MULHOLLAND. We were thrilled to partner with KET on that screening and are excited to bring back the movie that started it all!


As the kick-off to this year's Harry Dean Stanton Fest we will screen CROSSING MULHOLLAND at the Farish Theater on Friday, July 13. The screening will be followed by a Q&A with director Tom Thurman as well as some of the friends and family who are featured in the film: Donnie Fritts, Jim Huggins, and Jamie James!


This is a free event. Doors open at 6 pm and the film will begin at 7.


Since 1992, Tom Thurman has produced and directed over 30 documentaries on art, film, music, sports and literary figures, including Nick Nolte, Warren Oates, Ben Johnson, Harry Crews, Jerry Wexler, Tod Browning, John Ford, Hunter S. Thompson, and Sam Peckinpah. As a producer/writer for Kentucky Educational Television in Lexington, Thurman has directed documentaries for the series Kentucky Muse, a showcase for artists with Kentucky roots. Programs in this series created by Thurman include In the Garden of Music (about musician Harry Pickens), Picture This (about photographer Julius Friedman) and Crossing Mulholland (about actor Harry Dean Stanton).

title: The Handsome Family
brief_description: The Handsome Family’s greatest gift lies in its tremendous talent for painting vivid, sometimes terrifying pictures with every word— NPR
description:
The Handsome Family’s greatest gift lies in its tremendous talent for painting vivid, sometimes terrifying pictures with every word— NPR


The Handsome Family’s absorbing vision of decay and entropy is quietly unsettling and makes most other modern roots music seem like child’s play—MOTHER JONES


Words that in their everyday surrealism have no parallel in contemporary writing... Music that mines the deep veins of fatalism in the Appalachian voice — GREIL MARCUS


As songwriters it’s the eerie, ancestral voice of ‘Anonymous’ they ultimately resemble the most —CHICAGO READER


Through the Trees (1998)—10 essential Americana records of all time — MOJO

In the Air (2000) —One of the most important records of the 21st century — UNCUT 'Weightless Again'—100 best songs ever written about heartbreak— THE GUARDIAN, UK

title: George Clinton & the Parliament Funkadelic
brief_description: The Lyric Theatre is pleased to announce George Clinton and the Parliament Funkadelic
description:
The Lyric Theatre is pleased to announce George Clinton and the Parliament Funkadelic to hit the Lyric Theatre Stage on Thursday, August 23.


Tickets are set at $65 Advance $70 Day Of plus ticket fees. Individual tickets will go on sale to the public on Monday, April 30 at 2 pm.


Currently, you can purchase the 'We Want The Funk' Ticket Package. This package includes 2 Best Seats in the House, 2 Funk Fridays passes, 2 Lyric T-shirts, 2 Lyric Concession Drinks, and 2 $2 Popcorn Bags for just $100 plus ticket fees. 


'We Want The Funk' Ticket Package will be available only from Friday, April 20 to Friday, April 27 at 5 pm. Limited number of ticket packages available.

title: Bit Brigade Performs Mega Man II + Castlevania
brief_description: Bit Brigade performs rock covers of full NES game soundtracks as their gamer speedruns the game live on stage
description:
New Cosmic location TBA


Bit Brigade performs rock covers of full NES game soundtracks as their gamer speedruns the game live on stage. 


'When was the last time you attended a live music performance with a genuine element of risk involved? And no, going to a Gwar show with a white t-shirt on doesn't count. When Bit Brigade takes the stage your mind will frantically oscillate between 'Oh! Agh!! Please don't die!!' and 'YES! He's doing it!!' Combining the dread and daring of a live video game speed run with the spot-on technique of a live band covering the musical accompaniment to everything you're seeing on-screen in real time, Bit Brigade will have you swinging between the two mediums. From thrashing about to live renditions of your favorite stage themes, fingers yearning to the sky in a rock 'n roll parody of sea anemones seeming to silently plead, 'Please, feed us more fretboard pyrotechnics!,' to being locked in stock-still rapture as the infallible maestro of the d-pad, Noah McCarthy, takes on the final boss and risks his video game life under the threat of intense peer scorn (or the reward of night-long glory and a credits score). No matter the outcome, Bit Brigade must play on until the deed is done - which it always is - on the first (and last) try. Once Noah’s NES buzzes on, there’s no turning back.' - Metalhead Mike of The Shizz, summer 2011
